description:
Amu Hinamori is a 5th grade transfer student who is fashionably cool, tough and independent. Despite this, she is also a girl who seems unapproachable, both at home and at school. In reality, the "Cool and Spicy" role she plays is just a facade that she unconsciously plays. With her guardian characters, she fights the Easter Company who is extracting people's eggs to create X Eggs & X Characters in search of a special egg called the Embryo.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Fashion
tags.description: Centers around the fashion industry.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

[Profile (Aoni)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/ito-kanae.html) | [Profile (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/itokanae/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanae_1126_ito) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/itokanae_info) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ito-kanae/)

After graduating from high school, Kanae enrolled at the Amusement Media Academy, a vocational school for voice actors and artists, and graduated in 2007. Prior to graduating she was a member of two voice acting groups called Koetchi (こえっち) and Rirachitchi (りらちっち) before both groups disbanded in December 2005 and January 28, 2007 respectively.

Her first major role came in 2007 when she played the lead heroine, Amu Hinamori, from the anime Shugo Chara!. The show became a hit and Kanae was praised by critics. Since then, she has voiced Amu in other Shugo Chara! franchises including radio serials, drama CDs and video games.  

She and fellow voice actress Aki Toyosaki are good friends who worked together on several anime including Shugo Chara!, To Love-Ru, The World God Only Knows, Hanasaku Iroha and Toaru Kagaku no Railgun (both also hosted the Toaru Kagaku no Railgun web radio show, Radio no Railgun). 

She was also nominated for "Best Rookie Voice Actress," at the 4th Seiyuu Awards.  

In January 1st, 2024, she announced on both her blog and Twitter account that she got married to a man from outside the entertainment industry.

Non-Anime Roles:

Campanella - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

Peach-Pit is a female manga artist duo from Japan, made up of Banri Sendou (千道 万里) and Shibuko Ebara (えばら 渋子). Their group name derives from the diner hangout in the TV show Beverly Hills 90210. Although both have similar styles, with some artwork it is possible to identify which artist drew it. Both are known for their bishoujo styled works. As noted in their books, they are both Geminis and have "Almost flushed our phones down the toilet... twice."

The two of them grew up together and went to the same elementary school and have been best friends ever since. Both started as doujinshi manga artists, but not as Peach-Pit. Then they were scouted by Dengeki Comic Gao!.

Buono! is a former Hello! Project unit consisting of three Hello! Project Kids members  Momoko Tsugunaga and Miyabi Natsuyaki from [Berryz Kobo](https://anilist.co/staff/100550/), and [Airi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/165660) from [°C-ute](https://anilist.co/staff/100551/).  The unit was officially announced at the Nakayoshi magazine Festival 2007 on July 21, 2007, at Tokyo's Sunshine City in Ikebukuro, and formed to sing both the opening ("Kokoro no Tamago") and ending ("Honto no Jibun") themes for the anime adaptation of the Shugo Chara! manga.  On July 20, 2008, Anime News Network officially stated that the unit will continue recording for a second year. The group only did the ending themes for the second Shugo Chara! series ("Shugo Chara! Doki").

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.
__Kudou Susumu__ is a director and storyboard artist.
__Kudou Susumu__ is a director and storyboard artist.

Shingo Suzuki is an animator previously belonging to Gonzo and Satelight and now affiliated with GoHands.  He was being influenced by Masami Obari and Fumihide Sai and is particularly known for his bold and peculiar shading and high level drawings.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sna72860) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村誠_(脚本家%29)

Affiliated with [Frontier Works](https://anilist.co/studio/61/).

Initially he was mainly a scriptwriter for radio programs, but ever since his involvement on [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/144/) in 2002, he has been working on animation-related projects as both scriptwriter and producer.

In 2010, he made his directorial debut with the puppet animation [Cheburashka](https://anilist.co/anime/9340/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [either](https://anilist.co/staff/134789/) of [the two](https://anilist.co/staff/265458/) animators._
Originating from Green Box.

__Real Name:__ Yuusuke Hiroshima (広島 祐介)

[Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=43614)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kimiyatrx)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kimiyatrx)

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須永司)

__Alma mater:__ Osaka University of Arts

Hiromitsu Kanazawa is a director formerly belonging to Satelight, now affiliated with GoHands.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kimiyatrx)
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/218342/) or the [painter](https://anilist.co/staff/149497/) by the same name._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/majimegawa)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
